content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Iron Smelting Furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0)
Consists of a single furnace used to convert iron ore (with coal as fuel) into iron plates, supporting the production chain for advanced items.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at Position(-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of a single furnace used to convert copper ore (with coal as fuel) into copper plates, forming the basis for downstream copper processing such as copper cable production.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Call Consistency – Avoid using unexpected parameters or incorrect argument styles when invoking functions like get_entities. Use the proper signature (e.g. do not supply a keyword argument like “radius” if not supported, and ensure that the expected number of positional arguments is met).
  
• Return Value Handling – When a function (such as get_entities) might return None, validate its output before iterating over it to prevent “NoneType” errors. Adopt a fallback (e.g. default to an empty list) when necessary.
  
• Inventory Verification – Confirm that a required item (for example, a Lab) is present in the inventory before attempting to place it on the map, preventing placement errors due to missing inventory items.
  
• Resource Chain Management in Crafting – When crafting complex items like a Lab, ensure that all prerequisite sub-ingredients (e.g. iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, copper-cables) are sufficiently available. Verify resource availability and production capabilities for each dependency to avoid crafting failures.
